title: London Film Festival 2019: the 15 must-see movies
text:
In the awards season calendar, think of the London Film Festival as the first Sunday of Advent. Christmas morning – for which, read the Oscars – might still seem a long way off, but it’s coming.

When the LFF was founded in 1957, awards season as we know it simply didn’t exist. But the event’s stated aim to be a “festival of festivals”, which brought together the best of the heavyweight line-ups at Cannes, Venice and elsewhere, meant it became an excellent primer on the big talking-point releases ahead.

These days, that means spotlighting likely Bafta and Oscar contenders, as well as giving a platform to world cinema treasures and cult classics in the making. Here are my 15 picks from this year’s...
